definition: tongue-tied/unable to speak (out of surprise, embarrassment etc)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless

sentences.english: The miraculous effect of medical herbs has raised some conservative eyebrows.
sentences.chinese: 草藥的奇效簡直使一些思想保守的人瞠目結舌。

sentences.english: Even if as for is not at a loss for words, also can only be ambiguous at least.
sentences.chinese: 即使不至於張口結舌，至少也只能含含糊糊。

sentences.english: And art made tongue-tied by authority.
sentences.chinese: 學術結舌失語，飽受當局鉗制。
彼得張口結舌答不上來。

sentences.english: I remember my jaw dropping. It felt like a ghostly image.
sentences.chinese: 我記得我張目結舌，它感覺像是一個幽靈般的影像。

sentences.english: Even if not a loss for words, at least we can only vague.
sentences.chinese: 即使不至於張口結舌，至少也只能含含糊糊。

sentences.english: Judged against its own past, Brazil is doing astonishingly well.
sentences.chinese: 以其自己的過去評判，巴西乾得很棒，令人瞠目結舌。

sentences.english: The 11/26 attacks lasted a mind-numbing 72 hours.
sentences.chinese: 26襲擊案持續了72小時，令人瞠目結舌。

sentences.english: Some people have become so fascinated by this practice that they have “extreme” piercings.
sentences.chinese: 有些人對其所見的“極端”穿孔藝術真是瞠目結舌。

sentences.english: James Murdoch was left stammering by that one.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯默多克被這個問題問得張口結舌。

sentences.english: One might say that her opponents display a syndrome called being tongue-tied.
sentences.chinese: 也許你可以說她的對手們都變得張口結舌了。

sentences.english: But it was the first time I saw this phenomenon and I was completely astonished.
sentences.chinese: 但是這確實是我第一次看到讓我瞠目結舌的景象。
傑克張口結舌，手足無措。

sentences.english: On hearing the news, his jaw dropped.
sentences.chinese: 聽到這個消息，他驚訝得張口結舌。
